alert.note: Alert for Gaston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 6:11PM EST until January 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County. .Heavy rainfall within the South Fork Catawba River watershed has caused elevated flows along the river and the South Fork Catawba River is expected to exceed bankfull in the Cramerton vicinity. Nuisance flooding near Riverside Park is expected this evening through early Thursday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River At Lowell. * WHEN...From this evening through tomorrow. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. South Fork Catawba River floodwaters begin to enter Riverside Park in Cramerton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.8 feet and rising slowly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action/Advisory Stage is 9.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
